section.title: Introduction
section.para: In order to increase efficacy and richness of navigation, EPUB Publications include a "Navigation Center eXtended," the NCX. The NCX provides a means for the author to provide a multi-purpose declarative global navigation layer that is independent of the content it references.

The NCX was originally standardized by the DAISY Consortium, as defined in Section 8 of . The EPUB specification defines its own schema (XML grammar) for the NCX content type, as some multimedia and metadata components from the DAISY specification are not included.

section.title: Key NCX Components
section.para: The following are the key components of the NCX document:

listitem.para: The exposes the hierarchical structure of the EPUB Publication. The provided structure is global, i.e. it transcends the boundaries of individual Content Documents in the spine.
In terms of the number of links provided, the navMap is often more extensive than a traditional print table of contents.
A is a container for non-hierarchical navigational information that is secondary to the navMap.

Multiple navLists can be provided, either representing constructs with homogenous semantics (such as list of illustrations, or all quotes of a certain author in an anthology) or with heterogenous semantics (such as the landmarks navList.)

The is a special-purpose navList that allows representing the location of page boundaries in a print source. A metadata mechanism is provided to allow explicit bibliographical identification of the print source being represented.

section.title: NCX Metadata
section.para: The NCX provides two mechanisms for expressing metadata:

listitem.para: The NCX element allows the expression of metadata concerning the NCX Document as a whole. This version of this specification does not require head metadata to be provided.

The epub:type attribute, as occurring on the , and elements, provides machine-readable metadata about the structural semantics of link target(s). (Compare with the element, which provides human-readable metadata.)

section.para: Mappings to metadata vocabularies used when expressing document and link target metadata are created using the and attributes on the NCX root element. The EPUB Structural Semantics Vocabulary is the default metadata vocabulary of the NCX.

simplelist.member: An NCX Document must be a well-formed XML Document .
An NCX Document must be encoded in UTF-8 or UTF-16 .
An NCX Document must be valid to the NCX Document schema as defined in , and in addition must conform to all content conformance constraints expressed in .
The NCX Document filename should use the file extension .ncx. Any document fragments (included via XML entities or XInclude) should not use the .ncx extension.

section.title: The landmarks navList
section.para: The landmarks navList identifies fundamental structural components of the publication, in order to enable Reading Systems to provide the user effective access to them.
The landmarks navList is identified through the landmarks value of the navList attribute. The landmarks navList is optional, and must not occur more than once within an NCX Document instance.

The structural semantic of each link target within this navList is determined through the value of the attribute on the descendants. The epub:type attribute is required on navTarget children of the landmarks navList.
